snippet: China limited searches on Monday after an unlikely stock exchange result on the anniversary of the crackdown.
abstract: China limits Internet searches after the Shanghai Stock Exchange falls 64.89 points, uncannily echoing the date of the Tiananmen Square crackdown on pro-democracy students on June 4, 1989; episode causes a stir in the Chinese blogosphere, and in a nation where numerology is taken very seriously.
lead_paragraph: China limited searches on Monday after an unlikely stock exchange result on the anniversary of the crackdown.

headline.seo: Shanghai Stock Market Echo of Tiananmen Date Sets Off Censors
headline.main: Market’s Echo of Tiananmen Date Sets Off Censors
headline.print_headline: Stock Market’s Echo of Tiananmen Date Sets Off China’s Web Censors
